events.message: I was involved in a severe car collision yesterday, and I am filing a claim for the damages to my vehicle and injuries sustained.
The claim has been categorized under auto accident as it involves multiple damages to the vehicle after the collision.
An insurance agent has been assigned to review the details of the accident and guide the claimant through the process.
The claim has been acknowledged by our claims department and all initial information has been received successfully.
We have requested the claimant to submit police reports, photographs of the damaged vehicle, and repair estimates for further processing.
The claimant has submitted all required documents, including the police report and scanned images of vehicle damages.
The investigation team has started reviewing the submitted evidence and assessing liability and damages related to the auto accident.
The investigation has been completed, confirming the claimant is not at fault and the damages are consistent with the reported collision.
A settlement proposal has been prepared based on the damage estimates and submitted to the claimant for review and approval.
The claimant has reviewed the settlement offer and expressed satisfaction with the proposed compensation amount.
The claim has been formally approved following acceptance of the settlement terms by the claimant.
Payment for the approved claim amount has been issued to the claimantâ€™s bank account to cover the vehicle repairs.
The claim has been closed successfully following payment issuance and confirmation that the claimant is satisfied with the process.
All claim documents and correspondence have been archived securely for record-keeping and future reference.
